pullRequest.body:
---

Wanted to put `preservesFiniteLimitsOfEvaluation` in to `Preserves.FunctorCategory` but that induces an import cycle, so I think `Preserves.Finite` is the second best option. Happy to take other suggestions though.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.FunctorCategory | 560 | 561 | +1 (+0.18%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.FunctorCategory` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.Types`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ preservesFiniteColimitsOfEvaluation`
`+ preservesFiniteColimitsOfNatIso`
`+ preservesFiniteLimitsOfEvaluation`
`+ preservesFiniteLimitsOfNatIso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Actually, it might be better to just create a new file `Preserves.FunctorCategory.Finite` to make sure that all statements about preservation of limits are inside the `Preserves`Â folder.

I'm confused. This refines `preservesColimitsOfShapeOfEvaluation`, which is *already* outside of  `Preserves`.

The current solution has no cycles, has the *new* preservation lemmas inside `Preserves` and doesn't change the import graph a lot. (Some of my commits might be out of the order of the conversation because I'm travelling and the internet is spotty)
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f7a2ac0e-40c6-4ccf-bfe7-0b9e2c242aa5) for commit e48079282c7364e4c6cb6d358f9e5b05521b70f2.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2bc62aca-c60f-4d9a-9369-1da41491feff/to/f7a2ac0e-40c6-4ccf-bfe7-0b9e2c242aa5) against commit 78a0b2f466ea466316f4a918ecdc26aab4a38cd9.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dagurtomas.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11166957549/job/31042073564)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11166957549/job/31042073839)
Please also revert all other changes that were a consequence of the import change

Rather than changing the imports here, you should put the declarations that use material from `FunctorCategory.Basic` in either the file `CategoryTheory.Limits.FunctorCategory.Finite` or `CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.FunctorCategory`.
Neither of these files work, because I'd need to import `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.Finite` in them and that causes a cycle.
Ok, then I would suggest creating a new file `CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.FunctorCategory.Finite`, and moving `Preserves.FunctorCategory`Â to `Preserves.FunctorCategory.Basic`
Hmm, the file called `Preserves.FunctorCategory`Â right now is not particularly basic. So it should probably not be called basic but something else.
I think adding the import `Preserves.Finite`Â to `Preserves.FunctorCategory` should work as well
If you do this just make sure to update the module docstring in that file
Somehow removing two unnecessary imports made my comment above obsolete and I now put it into `ategoryTheory.Limits.FunctorCategory.Finite`, is that ok?

```suggestion
```
This is imported by `Preserves.Finite`
This doesn't compile with the suggested removal

```suggestion
    (F : C â¥¤ D â¥¤ E) [âˆ€ d : D, PreservesFiniteLimits (F â‹™ (evaluation D E).obj d)] :
    PreservesFiniteLimits F :=
  âŸ¨fun J _ _ => preservesLimitsOfShapeOfEvaluation F J fun k => inferInstance _âŸ©
```

I think this should work (untested). Similarly below.
Never mind, it's explicit in `preservesLimitsOfShapeOfEvaluation`. Let's keep it in sync.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Limits): Some infrastructure for the preservation of finite (co)limits
